{{cpp/io/basic_streambuf/title | sputc}}
{{cpp/io/basic_streambuf/navbar}}
{{ddcl | 1=
int_type sputc( char_type ch );
}}

Writes one character to the output sequence.

If the output sequence write position is not available (the buffer is full), then calls {{c|overflow(ch)}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | ch | character to write}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The written character, converted to {{tt|int_type}} with {{c|Traits::to_int_type(ch)}} on success.

{{c|Traits::eof()}} (as returned by {{lc|overflow()}}) on failure.

===Example===
{{example|
 | code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::ostringstream s;
    s.rdbuf()-&gt;sputc('a');
    std::cout &lt;&lt; s.str() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
 | output=
a
}}
